intro: Antirrhinum coulterianum subsp. orcuttianum, commonly known as the Orcutt's snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that typically range in color from red to orange. The plant produces erect, branched stems and has lance-shaped, hairy leaves. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its blooming period usually occurs in the spring and early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
